interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
The United States is home to the world's largest economy.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
Mexico is home to the ancient Mayan civilization.
Brazil is the largest country in South America by both area and population.
Argentina is famous for its tango dance and music.
Germany is home to the world's largest beer festival, Oktoberfest.
France is the world's most visited tourist destination.
The UK has a rich royal history, with a monarchy that dates back over 1,000 years.
Italy is the birthplace of the Renaissance and is known for its art and culture.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef system.
India is the world's largest democracy and second most populous country.
China is home to the Great Wall, the longest man-made structure in the world.
Japan is known for its advanced technology and unique culture.
South Korea is known for its pop culture, especially K-pop music and dramas.
Russia is the largest country in the world by land area.
South Africa is known for its diverse wildlife and the famous Kruger National Park.
Egypt is home to the ancient pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Kenya is known for its diverse wildlife, including lions, elephants, and giraffes.
Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa.
Saudi Arabia is home to Mecca, the holiest city in Islam.
